# Color `r fontawesome::fa(name = "palette")` {background-color=var(--s1)}

## `r fontawesome::fa(name = "palette")` Why {.t1}

### [Which is easier to read?]{.txt-1}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

::: {.question}
WHAT IS THE MAIN MATERIAL USED FOR THE HOUSE FLOOR?
:::

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

::: {.question}
WHAT IS THE <font color="blue">MAIN MATERIAL</font> USED FOR THE HOUSE <font color="blue">FLOOR</font>?
:::
:::

::::


## `r fontawesome::fa(name = "palette")` How {.t1}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

This:

```html
<font color = "blue">Blue</font>
<font color = "#e33d30">Red<font>
```

Yields:

<font color = "blue">Blue</font><br>
<font color = "#e33d30">Red</font>

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

### Steps to replicate

1. Use [HTML font tag](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/font)
1. Specify a color
    - [Named color](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp) ^[Using the HTML 4.0.1 specification.]
    - [HEX colors](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_hexadecimal.asp)


:::

::::

# Spacing `r fontawesome::fa(name = "maximize")` {background-color=var(--s1)}

## `r fontawesome::fa(name = "maximize")` Why {.t1}

![](assets/spacing_problem.mp4){fig-align="center"}

## `r fontawesome::fa(name = "maximize")` How {.t1}

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Line breaks

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}

Code:

```html
This is some text
<br><br>
SOME TEXT AFTER A SPACE
```

Result:

This is some text
<br><br>
SOME TEXT AFTER A SPACE

:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Use the HTML `<br>` tag. See more [here](https://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/tag_br.asp).
- One `<br>` returns to the next line
- Another `<br>` returns to another line, creating the effect of an empty line

:::

::::

### Paragraphs

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}

Code:

```html
<p>This is some paragraph text</p>
<p>SOME TEST AFTER A SPACE</p>
```

Result:

<p>This is some paragraph text</p>
<p>SOME TEST AFTER A SPACE</p>

:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Use the HTML <p> tag. See more [here](https://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/tag_p.asp).
- Upside: browser automatically adds a blank line before and after each tag
- Downside: need to surround text with `<p>`

:::

::::


:::

### Get an emoji

::: {.panel-tabset}

### On Windows `r fontawesome::fa(name = "windows")`

- Press `r fontawesome::fa(name = "windows")` + `.`
- Type to search for an emoji
- Type `Enter` to write that emoji
- See more [here](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/windows-keyboard-tips-and-tricks-588e0b72-0fff-6d3f-aeee-6e5116097942#ID0EBD=Windows_10).

### On the internet `r fontawesome::fa(name = "chrome")`

- Find a website that contains emojis (e.g. [Emojipedia](https://emojipedia.org/))
- Search for an emoji
- Copy the emoji
- Paste it

:::

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

### Use in SuSo

- Emojis are (Unicode) text
- Write/copy as any other text
- Save/test. YMMV.
- See more [here](https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/questionnaire-designer/techniques/formatting-text/#other-elements-you-can-include).

# Improve inputs `r fontawesome::fa(name = "hand-pointer")` {background-color=var(--s2)}

## Radio buttons too long {.t2}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/radio_button_too_long.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Too many options
- Occupy most/all of a screen
- Easier to search by typing than scrolling

:::

::::

## Combo box too limiting {.t2}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/combo_box_too_limiting.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Interviewers don't know list
- Interviewers don't know to search
- Only see first 20 options

:::

::::

## When to use {.t2}

:::: {.columns .incremental}

::: {.column width="50%"}

### Radio buttons

- Less than 10 answer options
- Answer list to be read aloud
- Answer list not known / not amenable to search by typing

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

### Combo box

- More than 10 answer options
- Interviewer knows that searching to be done
- Answer list known / amenable to typing

:::

::::

# Integrate links `r fontawesome::fa(name = "link")` {background-color=var(--s3)}

## `r fontawesome::fa(name = "link")` Why {.t3}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}

![](assets/links_why.png){fig-align="center"}

:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Which questions involved in the error
- How to find them quickly

:::

::::

::: {.notes}

### Which questions

- Describing questions at length (which)
- Hard-coding question numbers (which may change)

### How to find

- Navigation might not be simple

:::

## `r fontawesome::fa(name = "link")` How {.t3}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}

```markdown
[text to link](variable_name)
```

:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Put text in brackets (i.e., `[]`)
- Put the target variable name in parentheses (i.e., `()`)
- See more [here](https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/questionnaire-designer/components/questionnaire-hyperlinks/)

:::
